title: American_Top_40_1981_Top_100
description:
"You're listening to our world-wide presentation of top 100 hits of 1981. I'm Casey Kasem and this is American Top 40."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is American Top 40's year end countdown for 1981 and was originally broadcast in two parts, on December 26th, 1981 and January 2nd, 1982. 

In this countdown 77 songs feature male vocals, 45 songs are by groups or duos, 42 songs are by male soloists, and 28 songs are by foreign acts.

There are 17 number one hits (three by women), 15 songs are by newcomers, there are 13 English acts, 13 hits by women, 8 remakes, and 3 trios (2 all-male, one all-female).

Five acts have more than two hits, there are 12 country songs, and 3 songs by the late and beloved John Lennon.

There is only one act with 4 hits, only 1 hit from a Canadian artist (but we all still love Canada), and one television show theme song.

You'll hear the talent of a man who put 4 songs off his first album into the top 40, something never done before.

There is a song that, as of 1981, held the record for most weeks spent at the number 3 position.

You'll hear hits from a woman who has had five number one albums, more than any other female act.

Also, as Casey introduces "Guilty" (by Barbra Streisand And Barry Gibb at number 35) he mentions the song at number 92 ("What Kind Of Fool" also by Barbra Streisand & Barry Gibb), but says it is at number 52.
